- IoT-enabled garbage bins send alerts when full, triggering automated routes for collection using ServiceNow workflows.

- Organic waste data can be tracked, and compost production reports generated to encourage sustainable farming.

- Real-time dashboards show waste collection stats, compost output, and CO₂ reduction, supporting village-level decision-making.

- Through ServiceNow Portal and notifications, villagers receive education and rewards for proper waste organization.

- The system can be replicated across regions, promoting rural cleanliness, green jobs, and sustainable development.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: Remote and rural areas often face poor waste management infrastructure, leading to uncollected garbage, open dumping, and environmental pollution. Lack of awareness and limited access to automated systems make it difficult to segregate biodegradable and non-biodegradable waste efficiently. As a result, villages struggle with sanitation issues, water contamination, and loss of fertile soil quality due to improper disposal practices.
